articles.headline: Rise in Loans Linked to Cars Is Hurting Poor
articles.snippet: With a crackdown on payday lenders, subprime borrowers are increasingly using auto title loans, whose high interest rates can lead to repossession and financial ruin.
articles.abstract: With a crackdown on payday lenders, subprime borrowers are increasingly using auto title loans, whose high interest rates can lead to repossession and financial ruin.
articles.lead_paragraph: The rusting 1994 Oldsmobile sitting in a driveway just outside St. Louis was an unlikely cash machine.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Michael Corkery

articles.headline: Crowds Gather as ‘The Interview’ Begins Screening in 331 Theaters
articles.snippet: The film had improbably become a symbol of free speech over the last week as hackers managed to get it withdrawn from theaters and then watched it open after all.
articles.abstract: The film had improbably become a symbol of free speech over the last week as hackers managed to get it withdrawn from theaters and then watched it open after all.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Carolers dressed in Dickensian costumes sang “Silent Night” at 11:45 p.m. on Wednesday here, as a woman with a strip of shiny gold garland tied around her head handed out hot cider.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Michael Cieply

articles.headline: Unsolved Killing but One of Puerto Rico Bank’s Woes
articles.snippet: The mysterious killing of a top executive is one of many troubles that have shaken Doral Financial and unnerved investors.
articles.abstract: The mysterious killing of a top executive is one of many troubles that have shaken Doral Financial and unnerved investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — It was near the evening rush hour when the bank executive drove his black Lexus along the four-lane highway here. Only a few minutes from the banker’s beachfront home, someone opened fire, shattering his car windows and hitting him several times.

articles.headline: Move Over Land Yachts, Compact S.U.V.s Are in Demand
articles.snippet: Consumers are flocking to smaller S.U.V.s, fueling a boom in vehicles that handle like a car, get the mileage of a midsize sedan, and yet offer features many drivers want.
articles.abstract: Consumers are flocking to smaller S.U.V.s, fueling a boom in vehicles that handle like a car, get the mileage of a midsize sedan, and yet offer features many drivers want.
articles.lead_paragraph: Susan Mahoney has for years owned a string of sport utility vehicles — land yachts that gave her plenty of room and a commanding view, along with a big fuel bill. But when her husband died this year, she realized she no longer needed, or wanted, such a cavernous vehicle.

articles.headline: M.B.A. Programs Start to Follow Silicon Valley Into the Data Age
articles.snippet: Leading business schools are breaking from traditional approaches and picking up the digital-age arts of speed and constant experimentation.
articles.abstract: Leading business schools are breaking from traditional approaches and picking up the digital-age arts of speed and constant experimentation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Greg Pass, the former chief technology officer of Twitter, put the matter succinctly. The M.B.A., he observed, is “a challenged brand.”

articles.headline: Affordable Care Act’s Tax Effects Now Loom for Filers
articles.snippet: Issues that will be handled through the federal tax system include health insurance exemptions, penalties, and repayment of excess subsidies.
articles.abstract: Issues that will be handled through the federal tax system include health insurance exemptions, penalties, and repayment of excess subsidies.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you decided to skip health insurance this year, consider this: Unless you can prove you have a valid excuse, you will be liable for a penalty during the coming tax season — and the time to start making your case is now.

articles.headline: Jerry Brown, Governor of California, Takes Second Chance to Shape Court
articles.snippet: Gov. Brown made a series of head-snapping choices for the California Supreme Court, picking nominees who were highly respected but had no judicial experience.
articles.abstract: Gov. Brown made a series of head-snapping choices for the California Supreme Court, picking nominees who were highly respected but had no judicial experience.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — When Jerry Brown first served as governor of California, he set out to reshape the powerful California Supreme Court by appointing its first female chief justice. But his pick, Rose Bird, had never served as a judge before and came to be perceived as a liberal ideologue.

articles.headline: U.N. Set to Cut Force in Darfur as Fighting Rises
articles.snippet: United Nations officials say their forces are routinely attacked by Sudanese forces and their proxies and that it is virtually impossible for their peacekeepers to remain without Sudan’s blessing.
articles.abstract: United Nations officials say their forces are routinely attacked by Sudanese forces and their proxies and that it is virtually impossible for their peacekeepers to remain without Sudan’s blessing.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — Under intense pressure from the government of Sudan, the United Nations is planning to shrink its floundering peacekeeping force in Darfur, even though renewed fighting there has chased more people from their homes this year than during any other in the past decade.
articles.byline: By Somini Sengupta and Jeffrey Gettleman

articles.headline: A Boy in ISIS. A Suicide Vest. A Hope to Live.
articles.snippet: Usaid Barho, a Syrian teenager who gave himself up rather than bomb a Shiite mosque, is one of thousands of children recruited by the Islamic State militants.
articles.abstract: Usaid Barho, a Syrian teenager who gave himself up rather than bomb a Shiite mosque, is one of thousands of children recruited by the Islamic State militants.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — Before war convulsed his hometown in Syria, Usaid Barho played soccer, loved Jackie Chan movies and adored the beautiful Lebanese pop singer Nancy Ajram. He dreamed of attending college and becoming a doctor.
